description.narrative: The Education Modernization Project in Tajikistan, seeks to avoid further decline in the education system, to instead support the rebuilding process, through improved learning conditions, school enrollment, and educational completion through grade 5. Specifically, the project components will: 1) provide school grants to improve the quality of education, the student enrollment rates, and the schools' infrastructure. Thematic grants will seek to encourage enrollment by vulnerable groups, in particular, of students with disabilities, and girls. Rehabilitation grants will be provided to those poorly maintained schools, namely for minor rehabilitation works. In addition, District Education Offices (DEO)will receive thematic grants, for issues focusing beyond Parent/Teachers Associations capabilities, while rehabilitation grants should cover works on DEO premises; 2) build capacity, and support the design of an education system, focused on learning outcomes, know-how and attitudes, emphasizing the skill needs for the new economy. To this end, new textbooks will be developed based on the revised curriculum, supported by technical assistance to ensure its appropriate management; student assessment, and data collection shall determine learning changes over time, and the need for change; support an in-service teacher training program, and training programs developed by institutions for professional development; and, grant financing for improved financing and management of the education system, monitoring criteria, and, technical assistance for new schools design; and, 3) strengthen service delivery, through credit financing of physical infrastructure, equipment supply, and textbooks development and distribution.

condition.narrative: Prepare quarterly Project Reports to monitor and evaluate the progress of the Project, and submit to IDA not later than 45 daysafter each calendar quarter
Prepare quarterly interim unaudited financial reports for the Project, in form and substance satisfactory to IDA, and submit toIDAnot later than 45 days after each calendar quarter
Prior to commencement of any works under the Project, preparation of an EMP satisfactory to IDA
Prior to effectiveness, adoption of Project Operational Manual in form and substance satisfactory to IDA
Upon development of the design for NTC to be constructed under Part B.3 of the Project, prepare, submit to IDA for review andapproval and adopt an EMP for the works

title.narrative: Stopping the decline - raising enrollment and completion rates through grade 4 in the project area.

comment.narrative: Estimated enrollment average of project districts. Baseline completed in phases in Kulyab, Vahdat, Vose, Faizabad, Shohmansur andNurabad (1/31/2007)

target.value: Enrollment rates increase in project schools in grades 1-4 to 90% of age cohort over 2003 enrollments, by the end of the project.

comment.narrative: The original PAD indicator was ‘through grade 5’ but ‘through grade 4’ has been tracked throughout the project

actual.value: Average enrollment rate in grades 1-4 in project rayons is around 99.9%

comment.narrative: Target exceeded.

title.narrative: Transition rate from grade 4 to 5 in project schools is comparable with the national average

comment.narrative: Target met. (Indicator added to align with PAD)

title.narrative: Support for community initiatives -- thematic grants.

baseline.value: Lack of community involvement in school activities.

target.value: 228 schools receiving thematic grants complete and produce satisfactoryreports.

comment.narrative: target exceeded

actual.value: 493 thematic grants have been completed in 405 schools of 7 pilot districts (86% of total school number).

comment.narrative: target exceeded

title.narrative: Strengthening service delivery -- improvement of school infrastructure.

baseline.value: Large school buildings are in urgent need of repair due to maintenance neglect and intensive use.

comment.narrative: target exceeded due to the project savings.

title.narrative: Community driven projects ensure that parents and community members are active in promoting education.

baseline.value: No schools had PTAs, though some had school committees

target.value: Functioning school committees/PTAs in 70% of project schools.

actual.value: Functioning school committees/PTAs in 86% of the project schools.

comment.narrative: Savings were used for additional small grants to 13 PTAs for rehabilitation thus demonstrating sustainability of the component.Also, 405 schools (86%) have received and successfully completed small grants

title.narrative: Support for community initiatives -- rehabilitation grants.

baseline.value: School buildings are in urgent need of repair due to maintenance neglect and intensive use.

comment.narrative: Target exceeded. Project savings were used for additional small grants to 13 PTAs for rehabilitation thus demonstratingsustainability of the component

title.narrative: Support for capacity building --- Introduction of per-capita funding in one pilot district.

baseline.value: School funding is based on norms, not actual needs and demand.

target.value: Per-capita funding pilot evaluated and recommendations for scaling-up the whole country were presented to the Government.

actual.value: PCF is introduced and functioning nationwide since 2010

title.narrative: Strengthening service delivery -- printing of textbooks.

comment.narrative: Target exceeded

title.narrative: Support for capacity building -- new titles developed and printed for primary grades.

baseline.value: Textbooks used in primary schools are outdated.

target.value: 5 new titles developed and printed for primary grades.

actual.value: 8 new titles or primary grades developed, printed and delivered to schools.

comment.narrative: Target exceeded

title.narrative: Support for capacity building -- Student assessment capacity for 4th grade established.

baseline.value: There is no capacity for conducting regular student assessment.

target.value: 4th grade assessment run successfully at least once in 100 schools in seven project districts.

actual.value: 4th grade assessment was conducted twice: in 2004 and 2008. The 2008 SA covered 2225 studets in12 districts.

comment.narrative: SAD is moved to NTC and further assessment work will be funded by READ

title.narrative: Support for capacity building -- Capacity for curriculum development established.

baseline.value: There is no curriculum structure or framework in the country.

target.value: Curriculum Unit operating and framework developed.

actual.value: The National Curriculum Board is operating. The curriculum framework is developed and adopted by the MOE

title.narrative: Project management - capacity to manage technical assistance

actual.value: TA is generally well managed and contribuite to capacity building of education staff.

comment.narrative: Target met. (Indicator added to align with PAD).

title.narrative: Project management - procurement and financial management

baseline.value: low fiduciary capacity at the PMU

target.value: procurement and FM present minimal problems during implementation

actual.value: No major procurement or FM issues.

comment.narrative: Target met. Advanced fiduciary capacity in the PMU and adequate - in the MOE. (Indicator added to align with PAD).

title.narrative: Strenghthening service delivery - two prototype schools designed and built to new designs

comment.narrative: Target met. The new design is used by the government for construction of new schools.(Indicator added to align with PAD).

title.narrative: Support for capacity building -- professional development of untrained teachers.

target.value: 350 untrained teachers receive training in seven project districts.

comment.narrative: target revised to 200 teachers

actual.value: 191 primary grades untrained teachers in the project districts received training and are certified

comment.narrative: At the MOE's proposal it was agreed to limit training to 200 teachers (out of 350) who have not less than 5 years experience intheschool. Out of those 200, 191 teachers attended the course regularly and passed the exams.

title.narrative: Teacher turnover in the project schools has decreased

comment.narrative: Target exceeded. (Indicator added to align with PAD)

title.narrative: Schools attract qualified teachers - percentage of teachers with "high" category in project schools is comparable with the nationalaverage

comment.narrative: Target met. (Indicator added to align with PAD)

title.narrative: Increase in community opinion of education quality and willingness to send children to school

comment.narrative: Target met. Results of beneficiary assessment.(Indicator added to align with PAD).

title.narrative: Support for community initiatives - grant funds target the poorest and vulnerable students in the communities

comment.narrative: Target met. Results of small grants and beneficiary assessment.(Indicator added to align with PAD).

target.value: Equipment procured under AF funding 100% procured and in place.

actual.value: Furniture and security equipment have arrived.

comment.narrative: Will be completed by Closing Date.
Will be completed by Closing Date.

title.narrative: Strengthening survice delivery - number of students benefitted from school furniture provision

comment.narrative: Target exceeded. (Indicator added to align with PAD).
